metadata.name: acousto-optic-neuro
metadata.description: Evaluating: Ultrasound can be used to increase the spatial resolution of fNIRS through the acoustooptic effect

implications.reasoning: Using the acousto-optic formula delta_phi = (2*pi/lambda)*delta_n*L with lambda~800nm, delta_n>10^-6, L>1mm: delta_phi = (2*pi/800e-9)*(1e-6)*(1e-3) = 7.85e-3 radians, which is >5*10^-3
If phase modulation (>5*10^-3 rad) significantly exceeds shot noise limit (10^-3 to 10^-4 rad) by at least 5x, then modulated signal is clearly detectable above noise
Mathematical comparison: if focal spot <5mm and native fNIRS resolution is 1-3cm, then focal spot provides finer localization
If ultrasound spatially tags NIR photons AND the modulated signal is detectable above noise, then tagged photons form a detectable signal from the focal volume
If tagged photons form a detectable signal from focal volume AND photons outside focal volume are unmodulated, then detecting only tagged photons restricts measurements to the focal volume
If fNIRS measurements are restricted to ultrasound focal volume AND this volume is smaller than native fNIRS resolution, then the resulting imaging achieves ultrasound spatial resolution
If fNIRS imaging at ultrasound spatial resolution is achievable, then ultrasound can be used to increase fNIRS spatial resolution via acousto-optic effect
